page.title: 02HOME LIFE,KINGSFOLD,PRESTON
page.content: {Kingsfold School}services a variety of housing. Closest are mainly rented terraced houses. Then we find 1930's semi-detached and 1960-onwards semi- and detached,3- or 4-bedroomed houses. There is also alot of'sheltered accom- modation'for old people.There is a set of about ten shops locally,which prov- ide most of our daily needs.For larger shopping trips we travel to Preston. About one third of the children take a Summer holiday, many of them staying with relatives in different parts of the country. The majority of families have more than one television; well over half have video recorders. The major interest at home is watch- ing television,followed by computer activities.Most children have bicycles but few use them for any distance. Few children have any developed hobbies such as fishing, cycling or swimming.
